column4: hi I am trying to make an app launcher. its runs from the terminal can I make some launcher that doesnt need launcher?
clarify what you are trying to launch...
make a laumncher that runs /the/full/path/to/matlab
what closes?
whats the exact command you use in the terminal to run matlab?
perhaops it requiers a terminal to be open.. ive never used it..
you could make the launcher 'open in terminal' or run 'xterm -e matlab'  also..
does 'matlab &' in termnial work? can you then use the 'exit' command?
you can make a script and the launcher can run the script if you wanted.
make a script? bash scripting fundamentals.
example script = 2 lines.. #!/bin/bash     matlab &
but i cant imagine WHY that would work and not running matlib directly
Upgraded sudo how exactly?   I dont see how that would affect X/mouse  tho.
it showed up in my upgrade center and I let it upgrade. then I installed sugar from sugarlabs to try. it wasn't broken till then suddenly now it behaves as if alt key is pressed
Its possible sugar did somthing.. but i doubt if sudo did.
I already removed it to check. if it broke something, it hasn't undone it on uninstall :(
how do I fix it now?
you may want to add a new user, and test to see if the issue also affects a newly made user
isn't there anyway to reset my mouse?
see if a new user works.. if so. then its the other users settings that are the issue.. if all users have issues.. then its some system config perhaps.
it's the user settings I made a new user and it worked perfectly
